{{Infobox Company | company_name = Vodafone Turkey | logo = [[Image:Vodafone logo.svg|200px]] | company_type = Private | foundation = 19 May 1994 (Telsim)24 May 2006 (Vodafone Turkey) | location = [[Istanbul]], [[Turkey]] | key_people = | industry = Mobile telecommunications | products = Mobile phone services, mobile phone related goods | revenue = | operating_income = | net_income = | num_employees = | parent = [[Vodafone]] | subsid = | homepage = [http://www.vodafone.com.tr/ www.vodafone.com.tr] | footnotes = }} '''Vodafone Turkey''' is a [[List of mobile network operators#Turkey|mobile phone operator]] in [[Turkey]], currently the country's second largest. It had 16 million active subscribers in March 2007 [http://www.vodafone.com/start/media_relations/news/group_press_releases/2007/telsim_completes_transition.html] - approximately a 25% share of the market - and claims to cover just about all urban areas with a population over 5,000. Vodafone Turkey is also the owner of [[KKTC Telsim]] in [[Northern Cyprus]]. On December 13, 2005, it was announced that [[United Kingdom|British]]-based mobile operator [[Vodafone]] had won a [[public auction]] to purchase Telsim, for a price of [[USD|$]]4.5 billion. The old ''Telsim'' brand was phased out on 31 March 2007 in favour of ''Vodafone'', in line with usual practice.{{cite news |url=http://www.ntvmsnbc.com/news/396410.asp |title=1 billion dollar investment from Vodafone |work=NTVMSNBC |date=2007-01-09 |accessdate=2007-01-10}} The company was founded by the [[Cem Uzan|Uzan Group]] in [[1994]] as '''Telsim''', and remained the only alternative to the [[Turkcell]] until well into the 2000s. Uzan's mounting debts, particularly its international dispute with [[Motorola]], led to the company being seized by the Turkish State Savings Deposit and Insurance Fund. Vodafone Turkey has roaming agreements with more than 500 GSM operators. ==See also== [[Vodafone]]
